text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses:
“Speak to the Israelites, and tell them, ‘When someone—either a man or a woman—takes a special vow, to take a vow as a Nazirite, to separate himself to the Lord,

he must <st data-num="05144" class="">separate</st><n id="1" /> himself from <st data-num="03196" class="">wine</st> and <st data-num="07941" class="">strong drink</st>; he must <st data-num="08354" class="">drink</st> <st data-num="03808" class="">neither</st> <st data-num="02558" class="">vinegar</st><n id="2" /> made from <st data-num="03196" class="">wine</st> nor <st data-num="02558" class="">vinegar</st> made from <st data-num="07941" class="">strong drink</st>, <st data-num="03808" class="">nor</st> may he <st data-num="08354" class="">drink</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">any</st> <st data-num="04952" class="">juice</st><n id="3" /> of <st data-num="06025" class="">grapes</st>, <st data-num="03808" class="">nor</st> <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st> <st data-num="03892" class="">fresh</st> <st data-num="06025" class="">grapes</st> or <st data-num="03002" class="">raisins</st>.<n id="4" />
All the days of his separation he must not eat anything that is produced by the grapevine, from seed to skin.

“‘All the days of the vow of his separation no razor may be used on his head until the time is fulfilled for which he separated himself to the Lord. He will be holy, and he must let the locks of hair on his head grow long.
“‘All the days that he separates himself to the Lord he must not contact a dead body.

He must <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="02930" class="">defile</st> himself even<n id="1" /> for his <st data-num="01" class="">father</st> or his <st data-num="0517" class="">mother</st> or his <st data-num="0251" class="">brother</st> or his <st data-num="0269" class="">sister</st> if they <st data-num="04194" class="">die</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="03588" class="">because</st> the <st data-num="05145" class="">separation</st><n id="3" /> for<n id="4" /> his <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> is <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> his <st data-num="07218" class="">head</st>.
All the days of his separation he must be holy to the Lord.
“‘If anyone dies very suddenly beside him and he defiles his consecrated head, then he must shave his head on the day of his purification—on the seventh day he must shave it.

On the <st data-num="08066" class="">eighth</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st> he is to <st data-num="0935" class="">bring</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="08449" class="">turtledoves</st> <st data-num="0176" class="">or</st> <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">young</st> <st data-num="03123" class="">pigeons</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="03548" class="">priest</st>, <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="06607" class="">entrance</st> to the <st data-num="0168" class="">tent</st> of <st data-num="04150" class="">meeting</st>.

Then the <st data-num="03548" class="">priest</st> will <st data-num="06213" class="">offer</st> <st data-num="0259" class="">one</st> for a <st data-num="02403" class="">purification offering</st><n id="1" /> and the <st data-num="0259" class="">other</st><n id="2" /> as a <st data-num="05930" class="">burnt offering</st>,<n id="3" /> and <st data-num="03722" class="">make atonement</st><n id="4" /> <st data-num="05921" class="">for</st> him, <st data-num="0834" class="">because of</st> his <st data-num="02398" class="">transgression</st><n id="5" /> <st data-num="05921" class="">in regard to</st> the <st data-num="05315" class="">corpse</st>. So he must <st data-num="06942" class="">reconsecrate</st><n id="6" /> his <st data-num="07218" class="">head</st> on <st data-num="01931" class="">that</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st>.
He must rededicate to the Lord the days of his separation and bring a male lamb in its first year as a reparation offering, but the former days will not be counted because his separation was defiled.
“‘Now this is the law of the Nazirite: When the days of his separation are fulfilled, he must be brought to the entrance of the tent of meeting,

and he must present his offering to the Lord: one male lamb in its first year without blemish for a burnt offering, one ewe lamb in its first year without blemish for a purification offering, one ram without blemish for a peace offering,
and a basket of bread made without yeast, cakes of fine flour mixed with olive oil, wafers made without yeast and smeared with olive oil, and their grain offering and their drink offerings.
“‘Then the priest must present all these before the Lord and offer his purification offering and his burnt offering.
Then he must offer the ram as a peace offering to the Lord along with the basket of bread made without yeast; the priest must also offer his grain offering and his drink offering.
“‘Then the Nazirite must shave his consecrated head at the entrance to the tent of meeting and must take the hair from his consecrated head and put it on the fire where the peace offering is burning.

And the <st data-num="03548" class="">priest</st> must <st data-num="03947" class="">take</st> the <st data-num="01311" class="">boiled</st> <st data-num="02220" class="">shoulder</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">of</st> the <st data-num="0352" class="">ram</st>, <st data-num="0259" class="">one</st> <st data-num="02471" class="">cake</st> <st data-num="04682" class="">made without yeast</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="05536" class="">basket</st>, and <st data-num="0259" class="">one</st> <st data-num="07550" class="">wafer</st> <st data-num="04682" class="">made without yeast</st>, and <st data-num="05414" class="">put</st> them <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="03709" class="">hands</st> of the <st data-num="05139" class="">Nazirite</st> <st data-num="0310" class="">after</st> he has <st data-num="01548" class="">shaved</st> his <st data-num="05145" class="">consecrated head</st>;<n id="1" />

then the priest must wave them as a wave offering before the Lord; it is a holy portion for the priest, together with the breast of the wave offering and the thigh of the raised offering. After this the Nazirite may drink wine.

“‘This is the law of the Nazirite who vows to the Lord his offering according to his separation, as well as whatever else he can provide. Thus he must fulfill his vow that he makes, according to the law of his separation.’”
The Lord spoke to Moses:
“Tell Aaron and his sons, ‘This is the way you are to bless the Israelites. Say to them:
“‘“The Lord bless you and protect you;

The Lord make his face to shine upon you,

and be gracious to you;

The Lord lift up his countenance upon you

and give you peace.”’”
“So they will put my name on the Israelites, and I will bless them.”
